items.title: General Motors beats Wall Street estimates, reassesses full-year guidance amid auto tariffs
items.content: GM beat expectations but is reassessing its 2025 guidance and suspending any additional stock buybacks amid expected cost increases and industry uncertainty.
items.contentSnippet: GM beat expectations but is reassessing its 2025 guidance and suspending any additional stock buybacks amid expected cost increases and industry uncertainty.

items.title: Pfizer expands cost cuts, tops quarterly profit estimates even as sales fall
items.content: Pfizer maintained its 2025 guidance but noted it does not include any impact of tariffs or trade policy, "which we are unable to predict at this time."
items.contentSnippet: Pfizer maintained its 2025 guidance but noted it does not include any impact of tariffs or trade policy, "which we are unable to predict at this time."

items.title: SoFi CEO says fintech bank is bringing back crypto investing
items.content: SoFi was forced to drop crypto investing in late 2023 as part of becoming a regulated bank.
items.contentSnippet: SoFi was forced to drop crypto investing in late 2023 as part of becoming a regulated bank.

items.title: Temu adds 'import charges' of about 145% after Trump tariffs, more than doubling price of many items
items.content: Temu, which sold customers on the ability to "shop like a billionaire" started adding "import charge" to orders in response to Trump's tariffs on China.
items.contentSnippet: Temu, which sold customers on the ability to "shop like a billionaire" started adding "import charge" to orders in response to Trump's tariffs on China.

items.title: Donald Trump Jr. co-founds new private members club, Executive Branch, with a $500,000 fee
items.content: Executive Branch held a launch party that included members of President Donald Trump's administration as well as wealthy CEOs, tech founders and policy experts.
items.contentSnippet: Executive Branch held a launch party that included members of President Donald Trump's administration as well as wealthy CEOs, tech founders and policy experts.

items.title: NFL's Washington Commanders return to D.C. in $3.7 billion stadium deal
items.content: The Washington Commanders will return to the District of Columbia and redevelop their former RFK Stadium campus, the team announced.
items.contentSnippet: The Washington Commanders will return to the District of Columbia and redevelop their former RFK Stadium campus, the team announced.

items.title: Wealthy consumers upped their spending last quarter, while the rest of America is cutting back
items.content: American Express and JPMorgan Chase, both of which cater to wealthier users with higher credit scores, saw spending increase to start 2025.
items.contentSnippet: American Express and JPMorgan Chase, both of which cater to wealthier users with higher credit scores, saw spending increase to start 2025.

items.title: Corporate sponsors are backing away from LGBTQ+ Pride organizations
items.content: Companies that were once loud and proud in sponsoring LGBTQ+ community celebrations are pulling back their funds amid an uncertain time for Pride organizations.
items.contentSnippet: Companies that were once loud and proud in sponsoring LGBTQ+ community celebrations are pulling back their funds amid an uncertain time for Pride organizations.

items.title: Plane tickets are getting cheaper as domestic travel demand weakens
items.content: Airlines are trimming their domestic schedules as leisure traveler demand comes in lighter than expected.
items.contentSnippet: Airlines are trimming their domestic schedules as leisure traveler demand comes in lighter than expected.

items.title: More Americans are financing groceries with buy now, pay later loans — and more are paying those bills late, survey says
items.content: Consumers are using buy now, pay later plans to pay for essentials such as groceries, as concerns around the economy grow.
items.contentSnippet: Consumers are using buy now, pay later plans to pay for essentials such as groceries, as concerns around the economy grow.

items.title: Buy now, stock up or delay: Here's what consumers are snapping up or putting off in the face of tariffs
items.content: Fears of tariff-related higher prices have motivated consumers to buy cars early, but it's also contributing to a hesitance to buy and a hunger for deals.
items.contentSnippet: Fears of tariff-related higher prices have motivated consumers to buy cars early, but it's also contributing to a hesitance to buy and a hunger for deals.

items.title: Novo Nordisk scores major legal win that bars many compounded versions of Wegovy, Ozempic
items.content: Patients flocked to those Ozempic, Wegovy copycats when the branded drugs were in short supply, or if they didn't have insurance coverage for the treatments.
items.contentSnippet: Patients flocked to those Ozempic, Wegovy copycats when the branded drugs were in short supply, or if they didn't have insurance coverage for the treatments.

items.title: MercadoLibre CEO says US-China trade war is a big opportunity for Latin America
items.content: Galperin told CNBC's Robert Frank he believes there will be a "permanent shift" in U.S.-China trade relations.
items.contentSnippet: Galperin told CNBC's Robert Frank he believes there will be a "permanent shift" in U.S.-China trade relations.

items.title: Private jet demand declines as tariffs spook would-be buyers
items.content: A new survey of jet brokers shows that even buyers with deep pockets are pulling back.
items.contentSnippet: A new survey of jet brokers shows that even buyers with deep pockets are pulling back.

items.title: As Trump targets Harvard and nonprofits, wealthy donors are wary of stepping up their giving
items.content: Many philanthropists are wary of getting caught in the political crossfire, but some are stepping up during the funding crisis.
items.contentSnippet: Many philanthropists are wary of getting caught in the political crossfire, but some are stepping up during the funding crisis.

items.title: Companies from Chipotle to Delta are worried about Trump's tariffs. Here's what they're saying
items.content: PepsiCo, Chipotle and Procter & Gamble are among the companies that lowered their forecasts.
items.contentSnippet: PepsiCo, Chipotle and Procter & Gamble are among the companies that lowered their forecasts.

items.title: March home sales drop to their slowest pace since 2009
items.content: Home sales in March were weaker than expected, due to higher mortgage rates and concern over the broader economy.
items.contentSnippet: Home sales in March were weaker than expected, due to higher mortgage rates and concern over the broader economy.

items.title: American liquor exports hit record high in 2024, driven by tariffs
items.content: U.S. Spirits exports reached a record $2.4 billion in 2024 driven in large part by tariff fears.
items.contentSnippet: U.S. Spirits exports reached a record $2.4 billion in 2024 driven in large part by tariff fears.

items.title: Hasbro forecasts as much as $300 million impact if China tariffs don't come down
items.content: Hasbro CEO Chris Cocks said the company will be forced to raise prices and warned of potential job losses as the company tries to absorb costs.
items.contentSnippet: Hasbro CEO Chris Cocks said the company will be forced to raise prices and warned of potential job losses as the company tries to absorb costs.

items.title: American Airlines withdraws 2025 forecast on murky economic outlook
items.content: American Airlines joined Delta, Southwest and Alaska in pulling its 2025 financial guidance.
items.contentSnippet: American Airlines joined Delta, Southwest and Alaska in pulling its 2025 financial guidance.

items.title: PepsiCo cuts earnings forecast as it predicts 'uncertainty' in tariffs, consumer spending
items.content: PepsiCo cut its forecast for its core constant currency earnings per share, citing new tariffs.
items.contentSnippet: PepsiCo cut its forecast for its core constant currency earnings per share, citing new tariffs.

items.title: Procter & Gamble CEO says price hikes are 'likely,' as Tide owner cuts outlook due to tariffs, uncertainty
items.content: Procter & Gamble's quarterly earnings topped estimates, but its revenue fell short of expectations.
items.contentSnippet: Procter & Gamble's quarterly earnings topped estimates, but its revenue fell short of expectations.

items.title: Bristol Myers Squibb tops quarterly estimates, hikes outlook as drugmaker braces for tariffs
items.content: The guidance revisions include the estimated impact of current tariffs on U.S. products shipped to China, but not Trump's planned pharmaceutical tariffs.
items.contentSnippet: The guidance revisions include the estimated impact of current tariffs on U.S. products shipped to China, but not Trump's planned pharmaceutical tariffs.

items.title: Comcast stock drops as investors balk at weakness in broadband
items.content: Comcast lost 199,000 total domestic broadband customers, reflecting the continued pressure on the cable giant's cornerstone business.
items.contentSnippet: Comcast lost 199,000 total domestic broadband customers, reflecting the continued pressure on the cable giant's cornerstone business.

items.title: Merck lowers profit outlook, partly due to $200 million expected tariff hit
items.content: Merck said the expected tariff charge primarily reflects levies between the U.S. and China, but does not account for Trump's planned pharmaceutical tariffs.
items.contentSnippet: Merck said the expected tariff charge primarily reflects levies between the U.S. and China, but does not account for Trump's planned pharmaceutical tariffs.

items.title: Trump considering exemption for automakers on some tariffs, White House says
items.content: Trump is considering exemptions for automakers from some tariffs announced by his administration, the White House confirmed Wednesday.
items.contentSnippet: Trump is considering exemptions for automakers from some tariffs announced by his administration, the White House confirmed Wednesday.

items.title: Southwest to cut flights this year, pulls guidance, citing 'macroeconomic uncertainty'
items.content: Southwest Airlines said it plans to cut flights in the second half of 2025 and pulled its 2025 and 2026 guidance.
items.contentSnippet: Southwest Airlines said it plans to cut flights in the second half of 2025 and pulled its 2025 and 2026 guidance.

items.title: Chipotle is seeing a 'slowdown' in consumer spending as 2025 gets off to a rough start
items.content: Chipotle's same-store sales fell in the first quarter for the first time since 2020.
items.contentSnippet: Chipotle's same-store sales fell in the first quarter for the first time since 2020.

items.title: Alaska Airlines warns of slower demand as second-quarter profit outlook falls short
items.content: Alaska Airlines warned of weaker demand, pressuring airfares.
items.contentSnippet: Alaska Airlines warned of weaker demand, pressuring airfares.

items.title: Corporate America shelled out millions for Trump's inauguration. Now he's upending many of their businesses
items.content: Corporations like Target, McDonald's and Delta donated to Trump's inaugural committee after skipping the last two cycles. Now he has roiled their businesses.
items.contentSnippet: Corporations like Target, McDonald's and Delta donated to Trump's inaugural committee after skipping the last two cycles. Now he has roiled their businesses.
